wikitext.*:
'''''-ndur, -nur''''' is a [[Quenya]] suffix added to names to indicate faithful service or servitude.<ref>{{S|Appendix}}, ''-(n)dur''</ref>

==Etymology==
From ''[[núro|-n(d)úro]]'' "servant", [[Sundocarmë|Root]] [[NDŪ]].<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 376, entry "NDŪ-"</ref><ref>{{VT|45a}}, p. 38</ref>

==Examples==
* ''[[Arandur|Ara'''ndur''']]'' = "[[Steward]]" (literally "King-servant")
* ''[[Eärendur (Lord of Andúnië)|Eäre'''ndur''']]/[[Earnur|Ear'''nur''']]'' = "Servant of the [[Belegaer|Sea]], mariner"
* ''[[Elendur (son of Isildur)|Ele'''ndur''']]'' = "Servant of the Elves"
* ''[[Cemendur (son of Axantur)|Ceme'''ndur''']]'' = "Servant of the Earth" (i.e. farmer?)
* ''[[Isildur|Isil'''dur''']]'' = "Devoted to the [[Moon]]"
* ''[[Meneldur|Mene'''ldur''']]'' = "Servant of [[Heaven]], astronomer"
* ''[[Pelendur|Pele'''ndur''']]'' = "Servant of the Border"
* ''[[Valandur|Vala'''ndur''']]'' = "Servant of the [[Valar]]"
